class Deck[source]

Deck()

Represents a deck of cards. Attributes: cards: list of Card objects.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

A Deck of cards is a collection of Card objects:

{% raw %} 
deck = Deck()
assert isinstance(deck.pop_card(), Card)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
NameError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-8cdcb42313c4> in <module>
----> 1 deck = Deck()
      2 assert isinstance(deck.pop_card(), Card)

<ipython-input-7-d642f6810bff> in __init__(self)
     12         for suit in range(4):
     13             for rank in range(1, 14):
---> 14                 card = Card(suit, rank)
     15                 self.cards.append(card)
     16 

NameError: name 'Card' is not defined
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

Deck.remove_card[source]

Deck.remove_card(card)

Removes a card from the deck or raises exception if it is not there.

card: Card

{% endraw %}

If we remove a card from the Deck we can verify that it no longer exists:

{% raw %} 
card23 = Card(2, 3)
deck.remove_card(card23)

assert card23 not in deck.cards

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
NameError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-10-1564cc05dfd3> in <module>
----> 1 card23 = Card(2, 3)
      2 deck.remove_card(card23)
      3 
      4 assert card23 not in deck.cards

NameError: name 'Card' is not defined
{% endraw %}

However, another card that we haven't removed, such as the 10 of hearts will still be in the Deck of cards because we haven't removed it:

{% raw %} 
c = Card(2,10)
assert c in deck.cards
c

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
NameError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-11-73a9f2fd84ac> in <module>
----> 1 c = Card(2,10)
      2 assert c in deck.cards
      3 c

NameError: name 'Card' is not defined
{% endraw %}
